1121833417480347648.text: Eth 2.0 is coming, and with it a whole lot of changes to the economics of Ethereum. So that we could understand them better, @yslcrypto and I dug into the specs to see what is going on. Find it on @hackingresearch!http://hackingresear.ch/economic-incentives/ …

1120583144392970240.text: The BLS12-381 Wahby-Boneh hash functions promise simple, fast, constant-time, and indistinguishable from random oracle hashing to G1 and G2. Prime candidate for BLS standardisation for the blockchain industry (Algorand, Chia, Dfinity, Eth2, Filecoin, ...)https://twitter.com/IACRePrint/status/1120410166741090304 …

1047873843023548417.text: Via community decision, we've delayed the #Ethereum Ropsten testnet Constantinople hard fork by 1 epoch to block #4230000 (+5 days) to allow clients to implement, test and release an update to CREATE2, countering a recently found EVM DoS attack vector.https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1014.md#gas-cost …

1041597854731493376.text: We're excited to announce a brand-new Ethereum 2.0 implementation in Rust! We've been working on this publicly for a couple of months now but we're making it official with a blog post. Watch this space, we'll keep you posted with regular updates. @sigp_iohttps://lighthouse.sigmaprime.io/update-00.html

1038364587995947008.text: High-level sharding update in 25 minutes. Various cool concepts such as system/data/state separation, delay functions, honesty/rationality assumptions and committee sampling, attestations, Casper voting, crosslinks, proofs of custody, BLS signatures.https://youtu.be/J6xO7DH20Js

1019137430845157376.text:
Our Rust implementation of the Ethereum Beacon Chain spec is now 99% on-par with the reference impl. We're missing a few BLS features and a couple of integration tests.

It's called "Lighthouse" -- another form of rusty beacon. You can find it here:https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse

1017770088416661504.text: People often ask me how they can get started with #Ethereum or related technologies. I just realized how I do it... I try to break it! If it doesn't break, try to understand why. If it does break, try to fix it. IMHO this is the only way to truly understand the core concepts.
